website_summaries.verdict: Although the pieces of this set come with some durability concerns, it includes all of the essentials for 2-team competition for a budget-friendly price.
pros: Affordable yet comprehensive, as this set includes 4 rackets, 2 shuttlecocks, and a complete net system
Comes with a large storage bag for transporting the entire set
cons: Net poles are wobbly, and shuttlecocks feel flimsy

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Birdies are made extremely cheap. After a few games the sticker stripe fell off. The rubber of the birdie feels like a cheap layer of styrofoam glued onto something else. That is also separating. The paint rubbed off of the rackets. The grip tape came undone. Save your money and go to the store to buy a good badminton set!! The craftsmanship on this product was poor. The net has shown to be just ok but is also not the best quality.
customer_reviews.author: Leah C. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Don't make them like they used to.
customer_reviews.text: The shuttle cock broke in 10 min, pretty much melted. The hair tie holds, 1 broke while setting it up. Replaced my wife's 20 years old basic set with this, should have repaired and kept it. Plastic posts are not looking that sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: LovesAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Utterly useless since the package came with some of the items ...
customer_reviews.text: Utterly useless since the package came with some of the items missing. To be precise the shuttles and the things to hold the net in the ground were missing so now I am stuck with this bag, 4 rackets and a net which I cannot put up anywhere. Please please don't buy this and waste your money. The bag it comes in is good though but the package inside is missing items and is useless hence.
customer_reviews.author: Sarmad Ahsan Siddiqui

customer_reviews.title: Quarantine savior for active kids.
customer_reviews.text: This product is Perfect for additional entertainment activity for backyard. I got this when the quarantine started. When my kids started distance learning this badminton set help me a lot with my homeschooling journey. I let the kids play everyday as I followed the school PE time and recess time schedule. It’s easy to install and the badminton rackets is sturdy. I would say this is Best Buy for the price I paid ($22)
customer_reviews.author: Mamacita

customer_reviews.title: Some of the wires snapped while installing. However, ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the wires snapped while installing. However, there were plenty of places where we could attach the wires for installation. After the first time, installation is a breeze. Slightly low for a badminton net, but just the right size for elementary school kids.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: We've been very pleased with this! I'm so glad I chose this one. It's been up in our yard for about 3 weeks and someone has played most days. It's good quality and easy to set up. We did order an extra set of birdies and have been using them as they are sturdier than the ones that came with the set.
customer_reviews.author: M. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: The handle is really a poor quality product. The small nob/cover at the end came off. Shuttlecock broke in less than 30 mins.Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: DHANEESH N.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The pkg was damaged but still wanted to set up for the kids who’ve been dying to do something with this quarantine times and the dam steaks were broken. So I contacted amazon to get me a new stakes to replace rather ordering a new one and I constantly get the same webpage please return etc. so Annoying. And yes it’s a piece of crap and the rackets are falling a part where the tape holds the handle. So disappointed with Amazon and the product. Not worthy of your money. Will for sure be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Mom

customer_reviews.title: Racket and Birdies Broke...
customer_reviews.text: Within the first week of use. We weren't playing with them roughly, so I'm not sure why the wire in the rackets unthreaded or the nose of the birdies fell off. I'm very disappointed seeing as this was a gift for Christmas to my family. High price for very low quality. One of the net spikes even broke in two when gently hammering it into the ground. Bad luck all around with this set. I guess I got the lemon...Be wary about purchasing because you might get a lemon set, too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: The bottom strap broke when putting it together for the first time. The first birdy broke in half after 1 minute of use. The second birdy lasted 20 minutes. I'm sure things will continue to break if we use it again. The rackets are sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: David Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Great for my grandkids coming for summer
customer_reviews.text: Great for my grandkids coming for summer. Good enough for young kids and all ages to have fun for summer. Tape came off 2 of the rackets already but I put black tape on and works fine. Don't leave rackets out in rain, will rust. All in all for the money the kids are having such fun and that's why I bought the set.
customer_reviews.author: Cape Cod Gramma

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $40 for some good family fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great for casual backyard family fun, & @ a good cost too. Assembly was what I expected it to be. It’s a $40 set so I wasn’t expecting it to last forever, but so far it has held up better than expected. Purchased a set of LED shuttlecocks to continue the fun after sundown, turned out to be an excellent decision & I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Can't hold up to the sun
customer_reviews.text: I put this up a week ago and went to take it down today to mow the yard. One of the ground spikes snapped off, two of the rubber loops cracked and split, and the net color has faded significantly from the sun. We live in Phoenix, but this was in May, not August. I expected at least a season's worth of play from this set, not a week.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a one-weekend use!
customer_reviews.text: For the price you pay, it's living up to that and then a little more because the racquets were much better than expected! My friends and I wanted to use it for just one weekend and not have to worry about keeping it protected and spending a lot of money so this was great to be able to get on Amazon! You def need two people to assemble and I was missing a piece but made it work regardless. It's a net so it's easy to figure out how to accommodate should something break or go missing.
customer_reviews.author: Lesleysing

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and Easily Broken
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t even set up the net yet and can already tell this isn’t a good set. The price was low so my expectations were low but I didn’t expect the racket to break within an hour of playing( a basic back and forth) definitely don’t recommend. The handle of the rackets are also highly uncomfortable and we had to use hockey tape to wrap around
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical over some rough reviews on these sets..but we are very pleased with this one! It's been out for a couple of weeks now and going strong. Stays in place and doesn't sag. Great time with family right now, brings back years of badminton memories from my childhood. Glad I bought the middle set and not the cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Marriner

customer_reviews.title: Broken stakes
customer_reviews.text: The directions are hard to follow, but we figured it out on our own. Biggest complaint is the cheap plastic stakes used to hold it up. Our son went to run under the net, but ran into it. The poles sightly tipped and the plastic stakes snapped in half. Hopefully we can get replacements, or something more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great set, simple set-up!
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a great set! Simple set-up in just a few minutes, and can be done by one person, though it's better with two so you can make sure the net is the right length and tension. Shuttlecocks and rackets are decent quality, as is the net, and we had a great time playing with it over the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi in VA

customer_reviews.title: Great price and exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I have made this apart of our family bonding. Every night we play a game together and this is a family favorite It’s sturdy and is exactly as it was described
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Bought the "advanced" model and not too impressed. The poles for the net are plastic and one on the clips broke off when attaching the guide strings. But that's not the best part! When playing the handle from one of the racket fell off causing the racket to fly through the air and almost hit another party guest in the head! A little while later another one did the same thing. This might be an ok set for younger kids but overall it's very cheap and a bit dangerous. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M Sey

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the set
customer_reviews.text: The set came on time (really fast). We were most impressed with the level of quality of the poles and racquets. My family is quite competitive and the net stayed up all day with no issues. The only con would be the thee string pull for the set up. Rather than using steaks with the poles, you have to pull three strings tight to get the net up. This actually worked to our advantage as we have VERY rocky ground and we were able to use the stings to get the net up straight and tight. Very happy with the set! We plan on using it over and over and will definitely get our monies worth!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Franklin Sports Badminton Set
customer_reviews.text: We've received the set promptly. Thank you. We have not had a chance to play yet for various reasons, one being the lack of grip wrap on the racquet handle. We were a bit surprised that the racquet handles did not come with softer handles. They were made of hard plastic. We had to order overgrip. We're ready to play! We'll come back and provide input on the racquet tension and net setup upon play. Three stars thus far for below expectation on the lack of soft racquet grip.
customer_reviews.author: Monnie Heminthavong

customer_reviews.title: Summer we'll spent
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the this set as it is at a reasonable price which is a big plus point for me. The rackets are sturdy enough. Spent the summer well with these. Good for casual use, have used it for two months 4x a week and have issues with it at all. The shuttles are adequate and the set up was easy - got it all up in 10 minutes using a mallet. I was a bit unsure about the poles being of plastic but after it's use I am well assured they are sturdy and durable. Net isn't heavy duty but works perfectly anyways. I am definitely happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: ABHINAY

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This product is not good. The net connection (think rubber band hair tie) to the pole fell out on the first use. It is very flimsy and does not stay up very well. The birdies provided are ridgid plastic and cracked the first time used. One of the stake lines broke the first use too. I would return it, but missed the return window...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Cost
customer_reviews.text: With being quarantine and 2 kids at home this is a great exercise for them while it is nice outside. Worth the purchase and recommend to everyone. Everything came as perfect.... except the stakes broke when I moved it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this badminton set!
customer_reviews.text: Our family and friends love playing badminton together! The package arrived quickly and all parts were in tact. Our only complaint is that the net is super low. It would have been better if the poles were taller.
customer_reviews.author: Ria_Bellamia

customer_reviews.title: Cheap set.. rackets broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: It's true that this is a cheap set.. we set it up with no problems. It does take a little bit of creativity and about 10 minutes, but you get there. However, the most disappointing part was the rackets. On the very first swing on two of them, the "metal" snapped right in half. We ended up trying to splint/duct tape them, which worked for the most part, but I would recommend spending a little more to get something you can use more than once (for 5 minutes).
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts. Package was new but a section of pole was missing. Not the end of the world but come on...I paid for a complete set. Easy fix but one star for attention to detail.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Will have to wait til we move but I see no reason we won't be perfectly happy with it once we do get to use it
customer_reviews.text: Did not get to set this up yet as our yard turned out to be too small and the neighbor's are jerks so we don't bother trying to ask them about part of it being in their yard. Will have to wait til we move but I see no reason we won't be perfectly happy with it once we do get to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Will not stand up
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to keep the net standing up and I followed the instructions perfectly and even had someone helping me. This net was not meant to stand up the way they made it. I was better off paying for a more expensive set!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Garbage dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The plastic clips the anchor strings attach to are so flimsy one was broken in the box the rest broke just after assembling cause of a slight breeze. Was able to play thanks to alot of duck tape.but became one time use instead of multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Best buy so far
customer_reviews.text: Poles r very flimsy but it works amazingly bought for y son n it's not to big not to tall. It's awesome. The rackets that comes with it r very sturdy not flimsy hard straight hit. Love this
customer_reviews.author: Leah N Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Read many reviews and am so happy with this purchase. Easy to follow directions and it is holding up perfectly straight. Order another set of birdies because the ones that come with this are flimsy. We are having so much fun playing in our backyard, our new nightly ritual with our kids. Just follow the directions, stake it straight and deep into the ground and you are good to go. Very addicting!!!
customer_reviews.author: lJD

customer_reviews.title: Everything about this product is cheap. Except the price.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 8 year old granddaughter. Cheap rubber ands that held the net on broke first time setting it up. Very cheap thin plastic ground stakes all broke first time putting them in the ground. Both issues I fixed using paracord and tent stakes I owned. Second day both pole bent and broke. Everything about this product is cheap except the price. Stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: glenn krininger

customer_reviews.title: Not Well Constructed
customer_reviews.text: This net is not sturdy at all. Our dog got tangled in one of the support ropes and when he pulled, the net itself shredded. It probably wouldn't hold up if you left it out on a windy day.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Totally useless as the stakes that hold the poles into the ground were missing. Bought this for an Independence Day party and was a big disappointment that is could not be set up due to missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Great set for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This set was great for our trip to St. John, USVI. It provided fun and exercise on the beach and at our rental home. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: L Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: Trying to put up this set was awful. One of the pieces broke, therefore we didn't even use it. Then, we couldn't return it because apparently it was past some date. Ugh. Now we have a broken bad mitten set that we cannot use. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: leon

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I can see why it's so cheep. It is quite flimsy, and doesn't stand straight. You can still use it despite this though. The rackets are sturdy and work well, although the birdie sometimes goes through the strings of the racket when you try to hit it hard.
customer_reviews.author: G. Humek

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality, played with once. That's all it was good for. Plastic pieces came already broke.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it, easy to setup, my kids out it up a month ago and it is still tight, even with some very windy days
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great for the backyard
customer_reviews.text: The set up was quick and easy. The net was quality and heels up well. I bought separate shuttlecocks and I'm glad I did. The shuttlecocks that came with the kit appeared to be cheaply made. Overall, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Visnadi

customer_reviews.title: Missing 4 poles:)
customer_reviews.text: Tried twice asking the company to send me the 4 missing poles before our vacation and NO RESPONSE. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RjVZ

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my sons 16th birthday. Kit came with everything needed to set up net. Lacked shuttlecocks, so be sure to. It those!! My 3 teen sons are having a blast every day after school playing badminton.
customer_reviews.author: Laxmom3000

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for a small price!
customer_reviews.text: The intermediate set was easy to set up and everything seems to be of decent quality. The shuttlecocks took some minor damage - I will be investing in a few more just in case. The net, poles, and guy ropes seem like they will hold up over time, but I am not as sure about the rackets and shuttlecocks. Overall I am satisfied and would make the same purchase again with the information I have now.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Durable, Family Fun
customer_reviews.text: Lot so fun. Set up is easy; we were playing within 10 minutes. Kids loved it! The net is solid and the rackets are pretty strong. We have younger children playing so that was a concern at first, but the racket have held up through a few tough and competitive games! Also comes with a handy carrying bag for storage or transport if you want to take this with you to another person's house.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Cheap C****e stuff won’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Action speak louder then words Within 2 days rackets and shuttle too were gone What else needs to write
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect set for us to have in our back yard for the summer! I wish it were a little more steady—need 2 people to put up properly and expect adjustments regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Petite version of badminton
customer_reviews.text: The set is higher quality than the regular sets you buy. The posts are much thicker and wider plastic. It has spikes in the bottom of the tubes you push into the ground for added stability. Unfortunately, it is shorter than expected. So while it's good quality it's not a five star item. Maybe that's how "real" badminton is played. I don't know. I'm just used to a taller net.
customer_reviews.author: Jen C.

customer_reviews.title: we love this set
customer_reviews.text: it is pretty and sturdy and we love playing it. a good value especially given the reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Dialteg Penn

customer_reviews.title: Great value and well made
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable value. The net is well made as are the racquets. They are metal with plastic handles. The birdies are okay. I recommend getting better ones (6 pack for $8) and you’ll have yourself a great set. Family is very happy with this purchase...for $30. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B.

customer_reviews.title: This set isn't worth $5 The poles broke the first ...
customer_reviews.text: This set isn't worth $5 The poles broke the first day as well as the birdies! Unable to use now. We played 3 times. (my 2 Grandsons and I) THIS IS COMPLETE JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: tdarling

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is not a heavy-duty set, as others have noted. However, for the price, this is decent quality! (It is a little cheap, but come on, you're only paying like $25!) Set up is best done with two people, but it is easy and fast. My 10-year old daughter LOVES it. We set it up a week ago, and she has used it every day since!
customer_reviews.author: LouiseN

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: We all had a fun day at the park with this set. Very easy to assemble and held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Garton

customer_reviews.title: Excited to play
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and I to use in the backyard. It seems sturdy enough for at least a year of fun. I’m hoping my kids will be old enough to play with us this summer!
customer_reviews.author: sunnyteacher

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY DON’T BUY
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to play some volleyball and badminton and then so disappointed when we unboxed. The net is super short but very wide and is just honestly a piece of junk. Highly recommend you STAY AWAY from this product. They didn’t even put the weights in the shuttlecocks and that was a pain too to get them in. Absolute junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up and excellent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and excellent quality for the price. Took less than 15 to set up and get to playing! Poles do not go into ground like old school sets. This has ground stabilizers and the net stays up well. Recommend for families to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend! Horrible directions!
customer_reviews.text: For someone who is not a regular badminton player, the directions were awful. The directions for the setup did not have pictures to walk us through and did not specifiy all of the parts. The parts were also cheap, as the bottom of the pole used to stick in the grass broke the first time we tried to use it. Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: I understand it is a good price for the product but you are better off ...
customer_reviews.text: Item is very cheaply made. Within five minutes of playing with this set the handle of a racket snapped in two while swinging it. I understand it is a good price for the product but you are better off doubling the cost and buying a quality set the first time.
customer_reviews.author: mark g

customer_reviews.title: very flimsy. Plastic poles broke when trying to insert ...
customer_reviews.text: very flimsy. Plastic poles broke when trying to insert into ground. Birdies bent and crumpled on arrival and they do not reshape. Net too low because poles too short. This is a pretend badminton set, not an actual set.
customer_reviews.author: vonglider

customer_reviews.title: Badminton set
customer_reviews.text: This was a great set for the price.. worked great and was of good quality .. comes in a nice little storage bag so U can keep it secure in the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better quality that other sets we've had
customer_reviews.text: This set is stronger that previous sets we had. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Brad A. Bigam

customer_reviews.title: easy to break
customer_reviews.text: We used this one time... left it set up in our front yard, and somehow, the black elastic band that holds the top of the net to the pole broke on the left upper side already. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole R. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Quality not really good
customer_reviews.text: Liked the set but the wire in the rackets started coming apart on the 1st use.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: No extra pieces for broken pieces.
customer_reviews.text: It’s fun and all but the instructions on how to set it up are poorly written. One of the piece came broken and we couldn’t fix it. There were no extra pieces to replace what was broken either.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even think about how short 61 inches really is until I saw it. It's good for kids but I'm not even 6 ft tall and the top of the net barely goes to my chest. The net is very skinny also. Scoring system" is a joke; it's a rubber band that goes around the poles which have #'s on them. Everything else is adequate, though. Good tie-downs and raquets.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: just in time, thank you sooooooooooooo much . you rock.
customer_reviews.author: ann nowak

customer_reviews.title: Great set & worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Fun, easy to assemble and has held up well with strong winds. Fun for family time!
customer_reviews.author: tb

customer_reviews.title: Rackets strings not well done!
customer_reviews.text: After only two uses the strings on rackets have become untied and they are now unusable. Very disappointed in the quality of the racket strings. Not worth the money if this is standard quality one gets. Franklin is usually better than this. Net was easy to assemble and so far is holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Looking for quality

customer_reviews.title: Nice set for family
customer_reviews.text: Nice set. Would have liked to have had tape markers included.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie E. Brugger

customer_reviews.title: A good afternoon activity set
customer_reviews.text: The strings on the raquets are dirt cheap loose, but for what your playing, hard to complain.
customer_reviews.author: Phill

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This was a great value for my BF's 30th birthday party. I needed a complete set that didn't break the bank. This set fulfilled that. I propped up the net, against stacked chairs. When I used this set outside with the poles, It had trouble staying up. It works great for a low cost fun. If you are serious about badminton though, I would invest in a higher quality set.
customer_reviews.author: Mina

customer_reviews.title: Great family game - Great intro badminton set
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a great way to get the family started with badminton. We set it up in a matter of minutes and were having fun.
customer_reviews.author: BeachGuy

customer_reviews.title: ... this for a camping party and it is a good set for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a camping party and it is a good set for the price. I was hesitant to purchase due to the not so great reviews, but it held up well. Fairly easy to assemble and disassemble.
customer_reviews.author: Jams

customer_reviews.title: Grandchildren sure had fun playing this in the back yard
customer_reviews.text: Grandchildren sure had fun playing this in the back yard.; Everyth8ing was there to set it up. Seemed sturdy enough. The pric4e was good also.
customer_reviews.author: lynn T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a graduation gift for my niece. She had asked for a badminton set and I was able to find this set within my price range. In her thank ou note she says that it was the best graduation gift that she got! She loved it and that makes me very happy! I'm so glad I was able to get her what she wanted at a great price and super quality! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jill Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Assemble gently apparently
customer_reviews.text: Tried to assemble for a graduation party. Husband was using a rubber mallet to hammer the pole into the ground and it broke. Couldn’t use it at all :-(
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: String snap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set a few days ago. Unfortunately, one of the racket string just snapped after the second day of use by my 6 year old daughter. I know it doesnt cost a lot for the set but not really expecting a 6 year old girl to manage to break it that fast. I was expecting a better quality from the brand😔
customer_reviews.author: Pearl calupe

customer_reviews.title: Not bad badminton set
customer_reviews.text: We have had this up for weeks in our backyard, and it hasn’t had issues. The instructions were a tad confusing, and the pictures didn’t really help. Great set for the price, and it’s allowed us to play multiple times. We will continue our badminton tournament tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Allen

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty cheaply made but I'm not using them for a tournament, to say the least. I use them once in a while with the kids and they work just fine. The net is also pretty low quality but if you handle it with care, you should have a few good uses out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Gazi8

customer_reviews.title: Kinda cheap
customer_reviews.text: Rackets are good! Birdies and net are cheap. But fine for the little kids to play with. If your purchasing for adults I would get a different set!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hosey

customer_reviews.title: Bad instructions, but works for its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Very odd instructions (almost worthless), but worked as expected once it was set up. I would suggest buying better quality birdies.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetlass

customer_reviews.title: Cheap set up rope.
customer_reviews.text: The rope that was included did not last long at all and I had to replace. Everything else is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Bolinger

customer_reviews.title: It needs more support inside the poles to make it sturdy enough to stretch the net properly and the strings ...
customer_reviews.text: Rackets and birdies are okay, but the net is cheap. It needs more support inside the poles to make it sturdy enough to stretch the net properly and the strings were not all the right size and I had to fix it before I could even put it up. After putting it up and them playing for about an hour, it fell down and the poles would not stay up. We're going to have to get a long dowel rod or something pointed to put in the ground and up the poles for support and stability. The net is also too short as it is. I would not recommend this for anyone but 5 and 6 year olds, maybe!!!
customer_reviews.author: pkkreations

customer_reviews.title: it's not the best made product but for the money it seems fine
customer_reviews.text: bought this as a prop for a beach party contest at a gymnastics meet (titled beach party, hence the contest!). it's not the best made product but for the money it seems fine. even if i only get one season's worth of play out of it this summer it was worth the price. i am hoping my kids would
customer_reviews.author: Betty L. Murphydwoske

customer_reviews.title: Decent product but ground hook broke in just 2 days
customer_reviews.text: The overall badminton set was decent for $50, but the ground hook broke in just 2 days after assembling which brought the net down in ground. Is it possible for the seller to just sell or send another pair of ground hooks? Please see the pictures for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Vijay Thupally

customer_reviews.title: Broke during set-up!
customer_reviews.text: BOTH the anchors that secure the posts into the ground BROKE during the set-up. A pole tipped while we were securing the line and the anchors snapped right off.
customer_reviews.author: RuFamily

customer_reviews.title: Like to not got it put together
customer_reviews.text: This thing falls down all the time. Took us forever to figure out how it went together
customer_reviews.author: Kristan J Crass

customer_reviews.title: Franklin Badminton Set
customer_reviews.text: Good set may last a while. The net is pretty good, we like outdoor activities. We ordered the more expensive classic set.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Not the most sturdy kit you'll find
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat for the price. Not the most sturdy kit you'll find, but it has survived being up for several months now and shows no signs of wear or tear in the heat, rain, and cold.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No shuttlecock
customer_reviews.text: All good except that it says in the description "2 shuttlecock" included and that wasn't in the package so we had to buy it at a store to be allowed to play
customer_reviews.author: Laura Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not the most durable product, but for the price, it held up for a graduation party. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great set for badminton
customer_reviews.text: Great set for badminton, although the net doesn't really come with clear instructions on how to set up. The raquets are quite flimsy, one of mine broke in half when it hit a birdie. The birdies are also quite flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Charmanderlady

customer_reviews.title: Terrific net, poorly constructed racquets
customer_reviews.text: nice net, adjustable and went up quickly and easily! The racquets are really cheaply constructed, so be REALLY gentle or plan on buying plenty of replacements - the handles are hollow and the first time we used the set, one cracked off after a not-so-hard swipe against the ground when someone went for a shot.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying for purely recreational purposes with no intentions whatsoever of even a game play, this is fine. The racquets are cheaply made, the netting not so taught and the grips are plastic. This is 40 bucks, worth maybe half that.
customer_reviews.author: OfCourseItsME

customer_reviews.title: Great product for limited use, great otherwise
customer_reviews.text: I love badminton. We play a lot, and some of the rackets didn't make the grueling summer, some lost traction from racket to handle. Like I said we play a lot, probably not the rackets fault, loved product , just wish they were more durable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for the kids
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for the kids! Pretty sturdy for the price I paid for it. My son even ran it over with the 4wheeler and its still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: ok for a few uses. The poles seem to be the weakest link of this lightweight backyard set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: rackets broke in a month
customer_reviews.text: Super excited for my 7 year old son to play, but he broke the strings of 3 out of 4 of the rackets within the first month. The rackets are still usable for now. Also, one of the birdies also broke. We haven't used the net yet.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Setiawan

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: This is a mini badminton net. Definitely not good for volleyball or playing with adults.
customer_reviews.author: VI

product_meta.title: Franklin Sports Badminton Set - Portable Badminton Set - Adult and Kids Badminton Net - Perfect Backyard/Lawn Game - Includes 4 Badminton Racquets - Intermediate
product_meta.description: Style Name:IntermediateEnjoy time outside with this complete badminton set from Franklin. This portable set is great for the beach, parties and backyard fun. Ideal for two to four players, this badminton set is easy to set up and is appropriate for all skill levels.
feature_bullets: BACKYARD OR BEACH FUN begins with this complete Badminton set
INCLUDES: 20' X 1.5' X 1.5" all weather net. Poles are 1.25" diameter octagon PVC and 61" long assembled height
(4) "Tight String" tempered steel racquets with "soft touch" padded grip and (2) A grade shuttlecocks are included to allow for multiple players
(4) net saver net clips and 2 top and 2 middle guy ropes included
GRAB AND GO: easy transport and storage using the included carry bag
